So security is two different things,
right? It's a feeling and it's a
reality. And they're different, right?
You could feel secure even if you're

is to split them apart figuring out when

language is actually a problem here.
There aren't a lot of good words for the

So if you look at security from economic

get some security, you're always trading
off something. And whether this is a
personal decision, whether you're going
to install a burg alarm in your home or
a national decision, whether you're
going to invade some foreign country,
you're going to trade off something uh
either money or time, convenience,
capabilities, maybe fundamental

you look at a security anything is not
whether this makes us safer, but whether
it's worth the tradeoff. You've heard uh
in the past several years, the world is

it worth it? And you know, you can make

That's how you think about security in

We all do it. Every species does it,

should I flee? And if you think about
it, the rabbits that are good at making

at it will get eaten or starve. So,
you'd think that
us as a successful species on the

be really good at making these
trade-offs.
